Variance decomposition for brms models

Source: R/var_decomp.R
var_decomp.Rd

Variance decomposition for brms models

var_decomp(brmsfit)

Arguments

brmsfit

The output of a brms model. You can use VarDecomp::brms_model() to produce a brmsfit.

Value

Returns a data frame with posterior estimates.

Examples


# Simulate data
md = tibble::tibble(
  group = factor(sample(1:10, 1000, replace = TRUE)),
  f_var = factor(sample(1:3, 1000, replace = TRUE)),
  n_var = rnorm(1000, mean = 0, sd = 1),
  resp = rnorm(1000, mean = 10, sd = 3))

# Run model
mod = brms_model(Response = "resp", 
                 FixedEffect = c("f_var","n_var"), 
                 RandomEffect = "group", 
                 Family = "gaussian", 
                 Data = md)
#> [1] "No problems so far ðŸ™ƒ"
#> Compiling Stan program...
#> Start sampling


# Variance decomposition
var_decomp(mod)
